title: Whitman Mission National Historic Site: Basic Information
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information             Basic Information           Physical Address           328 Whitman Mission Road  Walla Walla, WA 99362                 Directions         Airports are located in Walla Walla (11 miles east of park), Pasco (43 miles west), and Pendleton, Oregon (46 miles south). The site can be reached from US Highway 12, 8 miles east of Walla Walla, Wa.  Directions Details           Operating Hours & Seasons         Whitman Mission National Historic Site SUMMER HOURS: Memorial Day to Labor Day Park Grounds Open Daily  8:00 am to 4:30 pm Visitor Center Open Daily  9:00 am to 4:00 pm WINTER HOURS: Park Grounds Open Daily 8:00 am to 4:30 pm Visitor Center Open Wednesday through Sunday  9:00 am to 4:00 pm Visitor Center Closed December and January Grounds and Visitor Center Closed on Winter Federal Holidays    Standard Hours    Sunday: Open 24 hours   Monday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Tuesday: 12:00 AM - 12:00 AM   Wednesday: Open 24 hours   Thursday: Open 24 hours   Friday: Open 24 hours   Saturday: Open 24 hours      Additional Information View More       Visitor Center Closed :   December 1  - January 31  Closed                 Weather           Summers are hot. Hats, water and sunblock are recommended. Winters are mild and rainy with a few snow storms. Layered clothing is advised.         Fees & Passes     Entrance Fees:   Entrance Fees - $0.00 None         Visitor Centers       Whitman Mission NHS Visitor Center The Whitman Mission Visitor Center has a museum, a 25 minute movie, and a hands-on cultural items area for children.            Â    The park has a little over 1 mile of trails. The building foundations are located a short distance behind the visitor center;the path is flat and paved. The Whitmans are buried in a mass grave located at the base of the hill. There are two paths to the top of the hill. All of these paths are paved.    Picnic tables are available on a first-come, first-served basis. The tables are located at the far end of the Visitor Center parking lot. Each table can accommodate a wheelchair.
